information.highlight: Contact tracing helps prevent the spread of COVID-19.

information.text: The app will send you a Close Contact Alert if you have been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for the virus.
information.text1: To enable Contact Tracing for this app you need to turn on:
information.text2: and to get an alert you need to turn on:

checker.title: COVID Check-In
checker.question1:
**Do you have a fever ‚Äì a high temperature over 38 degrees Celsius?**

Symptoms of a fever can include flushed cheeks, feeling tired and being warm or hot to touch.
checker.question2: **Do you have any type of cough?**
checker.question3:
**Do you have any difficulty breathing?**

This might be like panting or feeling like you can't fill your lungs.
checker.question4:
**Do you have any loss of sense of taste or smell?**

This might mean you can't taste or smell anything, or things taste or smell different to normal.
checker.question4Label: Loss of sense of taste or smell
checker.virusIsolation:
These symptoms are a match for the symptoms of coronavirus. Remember, 8 out of 10 people with COVID-19 recover at home with rest and over-the-counter medicine.

## What to do next

Please self-isolate at home to protect others.

Call your GP to get advice and see if you should be tested for COVID-19.
checker.recovered: Good to hear you‚Äôre feeling better. Stay well by following the advice on hse.ie.
checker.noresults: You haven't tried the symptom checker yet. Start now by tapping the button above

noSymptomsWell.message: We‚Äôre happy to hear you‚Äôre feeling well. Thank you for checking in. Even if you are still well, please come back tomorrow to let us know how you're doing.
noSymptomsWell.advice: Visit hse.ie to read more about how to protect yourself and others from coronavirus.

noSymptomsNotWell.message:
Thank you for checking in. Sorry to hear you're not feeing well.

If you have symptoms like a runny nose or sore throat, you should behave like you have coronavirus and self-isolate for 14 days to protect other people.

Phone your GP to discuss your symptoms and whether you need a test for coronavirus.
noSymptomsNotWell.advice: Visit hse.ie to read more about how to protect yourself and others from coronavirus.

riskGroup.warning:
Because of your age, we would like you to take extra care to protect yourself from COVID-19.

People who are older and people who have long-term health conditions are more at risk of serious illness if they get COVID-19.
riskGroup.advice: We know this isn‚Äôt an easy time. If you need support or advice on how to manage at home, tap below for more information.

welcome.title: Hi there üëã
welcome.text:
COVID Check-In allows everyone using the app to check symptoms and get advice. It also helps the HSE to map and track how COVID-19 is affecting Ireland.

The COVID Check-In does not reveal your identity. You can share your age, sex and locality to help make the information more useful for public health analysis.

The COVID Check-In also keeps a record on your phone of any symptoms you've had, so you can check back and review at any time.
welcome.action: Yes, I'd like to use COVID Check-In
welcome.letUsKnow:
Let us know if you have
symptoms today

leave.title: Leave
leave.info:
Thank you for helping us fight COVID-19. We're sorry to see you go. When you tap 'I want to leave' we will remove all data stored by the app from your device including a mobile number, if you have shared one, symptom data and any demographic health data you may have shared. Non-identifying authorisation tokens stored on the server will also be deleted.

Random IDs created or collected by Exposure Notification Services cannot be removed by the COVID Tracker app. If you wish to remove these Random IDs you can do this via your device Settings.
leave.confirmText: Are you sure you want to leave?
leave.error: There was an error clearing your data. Please try again or contact us.

yourData.title: Your data
yourData.info:
The COVID Tracker app protects your privacy and does not share personal information about you with other app users. **Your identity will never be revealed to other app users.**

Any personal data you provide will be processed in line with GDPR and data protection law. You can read more about this in the Data Protection Information Notice below. **Your data will only be used in relation to the COVID-19 pandemic response** as set out in the Data Protection Information Notice.

If you need to be alerted, the app will start this process with a secure in-app notification. Separate to using this app, the HSE contact tracing team may phone you if someone with COVID-19 identifies you as a close contact. If you have a COVID-19 test, the HSE will contact you by text or by phone with results.

Take care with any suspicious phone calls, emails or texts asking you for personal information. **The HSE will not ask you for personal information by text or email.**
yourData.viewInSettings: You can view this notice at any time in Settings. If you do not want to continue, close and delete the app. If you consent, tap Continue to proceed.

sorry.title: Sorry to hear
sorry.info: Unfortunately you won‚Äôt be able to use the app any further. You can rejoin at any time. Just tap the back button.

ageRequirement.notice: You must be 16 or older to use this app

underAge.title: Under 16
underAge.notice:
Thank you for your interest but unfortunately you are too young to participate in this initiative.

Keep safe.

followUpCall.title: Contact Tracing follow-up call
followUpCall.intro: If someone you've been in close contact with tests positive for COVID-19, the app will send you a Close Contact Alert.  The HSE will also phone you if you provide your number below.
followUpCall.note:
The HSE may also phone if you are identified as a close contact by manual contact tracing. The HSE will give you advice and refer you for testing if appropriate.

The app will only share your phone number with the HSE if you get a Close Contact Alert. You can enter your number below, or add it later in Settings.
followUpCall.noteAlt:
If someone you've been in close contact with tests positive for COVID-19, the app will send you a Close Contact Alert.  The HSE will also phone you if you provide your number below.

The HSE may also phone if you are identified as a close contact by manual contact tracing. The HSE will give you advice and refer you for testing if appropriate.

The app will only share your phone number with the HSE if you get a Close Contact Alert. You can enter your number below.
followUpCall.noteSettings:
If you want we will try to call you to provide further assistance after you receive an exposure notification.

Your phone number will only be shared with the HSE if you get an exposure notification.

closeContactNotification.title: Close Contact Alert
closeContactNotification.description: Please check the COVID Tracker app now.

closeContactWarn.title: Close Contact Alert
closeContactWarn.notice: The app has detected that you have been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.

closeContact.title: Close Contact Alert
closeContact.intro: If you have received a notification from the app, or a call from our Contact Tracing team, telling you that you have been in close contact with someone that has tested positive for coronavirus, you may need to be tested.
closeContact.alertintro: The COVID Tracker App has detected that you have been in close contact with someone that has tested positive for coronavirus. You may need to be tested.
closeContact.callBackQueue: The HSE contact tracing team will call you as soon as possible.

todo.title: There are some things that you should do to protect others.
todo.selfIsolationDetails: For details on how to self-isolate go to [https://www2.hse.ie/conditions/coronavirus/self-isolation-and-limited-social-interaction.html#close-contact](https://www2.hse.ie/conditions/coronavirus/self-isolation-and-limited-social-interaction.html#close-contact)
todo.list:
1. Stay at home.

2. Do not go to work.

3. Do not use public transport.

4. Do not have visitors at your home.

5. Do not visit others, even if you usually care for them.

6. Do not go to the shops or pharmacy unless it's absolutely necessary - where possible, order your groceries online or have some family or friends drop them off.

7. Keep away from older people, anyone with long-term medical conditions and pregnant women.

symptoms.title: Phone your GP if you develop symptoms.
symptoms.intro: Find out more about what you need to do on hse.ie.

uploadKeys.title: Upload your Random IDs

code.intro:
A member of the Contact Tracing team may ask you to share Random IDs generated by your phone over the previous 14 days.

If so, you will receive a unique 6-digit code by text message to activate the upload functionality.
code.expiredError: Code has expired. Contact HSE to request another one.
code.error: There was an error validating the code. Please try again.

upload.intro: To assist us in tracing your recent contacts over the last 14 days, we are asking you to share your anonymous Random IDs generated by your phone with the HSE.
upload.button: Upload your Random IDs to HSE

uploadKeys.permissionError: We have not uploaded your keys as you did not grant permission.
uploadKeys.uploadError: An error occurred trying to upload

uploadSuccess.thanks: Thanks for uploading your Random Ids. This will help our contact tracing team to slow the spread of COVID-19 and protect others.

appUsage.title: App Metrics
appUsage.info:
The HSE would like to understand your use of the App for the purpose of improving it.

The app will collect anonymous metrics about how you use the app and the effectiveness of Contact Tracing processes.

This information is gathered by the HSE directly and does not use any third parties to gather metrics. **This information is only gathered with your consent and cannot be used to identify you.**
appUsage.settingsInfo: If you change your mind, you can change these permissions in Settings at any time.
